name: aws-rest-to-http-api-migration
description: This is an example application that uses OAS3.0 to define an API. The purpose is to provide an example of how to move from REST API to HTTP API in AWS

scripts.deploy-rest: aws s3api put-object --bucket rest-to-http-example-bucket --key example-openapi-spec.yaml --body ./REST-example-openapi-spec.yaml --profile home && sam build -t REST-template.yaml && sam package --output-template-file REST-packaged.yaml --s3-bucket rest-to-http-example-bucket --profile home && sam deploy --template-file REST-packaged.yaml --stack-name REST-API-Stack --capabilities CAPABILITY_IAM --profile home
scripts.deploy-http: aws s3api put-object --bucket rest-to-http-example-bucket --key example-openapi-spec.yaml --body ./HTTP-example-openapi-spec.yaml --profile home && sam build -t HTTP-template.yaml && sam package --output-template-file HTTP-packaged.yaml --s3-bucket rest-to-http-example-bucket --profile home && sam deploy --template-file HTTP-packaged.yaml --stack-name HTTP-API-Stack --capabilities CAPABILITY_IAM --profile home
